relation: Great for these types of students
Totally worth it if you want to get your basics out of the way.
Join clubs and hang out in the student union.
Delicious and with a wide variety.
It depends on classes and the professor. Usually it is challenging and fun.

This isn't high school. You have to be able to do the work and focus without the teachers telling you to. Don't stress out so much and use your time wisely; don't procrastinate! Join clubs and have fun.
The learning environment is inclusive and warm. Although it may seem like some teachers are incapable of teaching, they always get the class lessons done. Never underrate a community college.
pageTitle: El Paso Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {349923=There is a student union which hosts different events. Once that just passed was a fall festival for october. Then sometimes they have concerts., 337003=Make sure the counselors give you an actual degree plan. Don't let them look at your transcripts (if you are a transfer) and then just say you need to take certain classes. Make sure they sit down with you and give you an actual plan that you can follow. They didn't do that with me and I was planning on graduating in the Fall of 2013 so I could transfer to another state with an associates, and come to find out they were giving me the wrong classes towards my degree. I spoke with a counselor and was told I was still 5 classes short. I never saw the same counselor twice, so I was getting conflicting information all the time., 409672=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Cecilia from El Paso, TX 03/19/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 4 out of 4 people found this review useful. 3 of 104 Categories Comments Campus Safety The College has its own police department which is always rounding around the college parking and buildings. In the years that I have attended this college I have not had any problems regarding this. I feel safe, even when I take night classes. Clubs and Activities There are many clubs and activities going on during the semesters. They have the Honors Program, SGA (Student Government Association), Phi Theta Kappa club and many activities. Some activities promote physical health, like ‘Race for the Cure,’ and some are to help the least fortunate like food donations. Other activities are for students, for example Art Festivals and Art exhibitions. These are competition among students; the winner either gets money, a lap tops, an iPad etc. Great for these types of students
